column2: DELAWARE DMV TEST
column4: Delaware

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle
column8: Pennant

column2: 2. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column8: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 3. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes.

column2: 4. No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
column4: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.
column6: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.
column8: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: No passing zone ahead.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 6. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 7. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
column8: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.

column2: 8. A green arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must turn in that direction after coming to a complete stop.
column6: You can turn in the direction of the arrow.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 9. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 10. When you see this sign you should:
column4: turn right.
column6: watch for traffic to the right.
column8: merge left.

column2: 11. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column4: under no circumstances.
column8: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 12. On the highway, you should look well down the road:
column4: in order  to avoid emergency braking or steering.
column6: because it usually takes 500 feet or more to come to a complete stop on the highway.
column8: because it helps you keep up with traffic.

column2: 13. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: brake suddenly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.
column8: activate your stop lights.

column2: 14. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.
column8: slightly increase your speed.

column2: 15. The speed limit in school zones is:
column4: 20 MPH
column8: 15 MPH

column2: 16. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
column6: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column8: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

column2: 17. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn as they proceed past them.
column8: stop until the person is well away from the roadway or path of travel.

column2: 18. Your driving ability can be affected by:
column4: three drinks or more.
column8: at least two drinks.

column2: 19. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: drinking coffee.
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 20. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: closely follow the driver in front of them.
column6: maintain their speed through the work zone.
column8: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 21. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 22. Driver distractions include:
column4: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column8: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

column2: 23. Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
column4: it is not safe to pass.
column6: not passing other vehicles is prohibited.
column8: passing is only permitted in daylight hours.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Four-lane traffic ahead
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 25. As they approach the top of a hill, drivers should:
column4: prepare to stop if needed.
column8: keep a steady speed.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way
column8: Low clearance

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn is not permitted
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 28. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: yellow warning lights.
column8: red lights.

column2: 29. What does this sign indicate?
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 30. When changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
column6: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column8: slow down and check your left mirror.
